ComparisonTable.description: A high-contrast, dark-mode comparison table comparing 'InfluencerSeninle' vs 'Geleneksel'.

structure.layout: Grid-based layout. Desktop: 3 columns (Feature | Us | Them). Mobile: Stacked cards or scrollable view.

visual_hierarchy.winner_column: Must visually dominate. Use 'glass-card' class, cyan border glow, and slightly larger scale or z-index.
visual_hierarchy.loser_column: Receded visual. Lower opacity (0.6), grayscale or muted red accents for negatives.
visual_hierarchy.icons: Use Lucide-React icons. CheckCircle2 (Cyan/Green) for Us, XCircle (Red/Gray) for Them.

styling_rules.container: relative w-full max-w-5xl mx-auto p-4 md:p-8
styling_rules.grid_header: grid grid-cols-3 gap-4 p-4 border-b border-white/10 text-text-muted text-sm
styling_rules.row: grid grid-cols-3 gap-4 p-4 items-center border-b border-white/5 hover:bg-white/5 transition-colors

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. Refactor '/app/frontend/src/components/ComparisonTable.tsx' to use the new design.
3. Ensure the 'InfluencerSeninle' column has a subtle 'neon-cyan' glow and border to highlight it as the winner.
4. Use the 'glass-card' utility class from index.css for the main container or the winner column background.
5. Ensure mobile responsiveness: On mobile, features can be stacked or the table can scroll horizontally.
6. Do NOT use TypeScript interfaces in the code if you are writing .js, but since the file is .tsx, maintain valid TSX syntax.
7. Add 'data-testid' attributes to the table container and rows.
universal_guidelines: Avoid generic centered layouts; use asymmetry where possible.
Use 2-3x more spacing than typical designs.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
